dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Keller Williams Realty just topped Monster.com's list of happiest companies for 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Keller Williams Realty just topped the website 's list of happiest companies for twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Careers site CareerBliss launched its eighth-annual list of the happiest companies in America.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, with 175,000 agents? That's a massive real estate franchise. And they uh, really emphasize internal promotion, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, with one hundred seventy five thousand agents? That's a massive real estate franchise. And they uh, really emphasize internal promotion, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Austin, Texas company has 175,000 agents across more than 900 metro areas and claims to be the worlds largest real estate franchise by agent count. A Keller Williams Realty employee wrote on CareerBliss.com, One of the greatest benefits is how our company promotes from within.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, one employee mentioned that—how they're everyone is encouraged to control their own growth path. It sounds like a pretty empowering culture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, one employee mentioned that-how they're everyone is encouraged to control their own growth path. It sounds like a pretty empowering culture.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: All employees are encouraged and supported to be in control of their growth and career paths.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And Adidas came in second, which is interesting 'cause they're going through this big shift to sell more directly through their own stores and site.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Adidas came in second, which is interesting 'cause they're going through this big shift to sell more directly through their own stores and site.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, the Adidas Direct initiative. Meanwhile, Microsoft landed in fourth place, which is… surprising given some of the employee comments.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, the Adidas Direct initiative. Meanwhile, Microsoft landed in fourth place, which is... surprising given some of the employee comments.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adobe is the fourth happiest company, according to CareerBliss.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, I saw that—someone called the atmosphere highly competitive and draining. But then they also mention PDFs saving like, 80% on costs?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, I saw that-someone called the atmosphere highly competitive and draining. But then they also mention PDFs saving like, eighty percent on costs?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It claims PDFs have led to a 91% reduction in environmental impact and 90% cost savings when compared with paper-based processes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, it's a mixed bag. And then Biogen at number five—their top seller Humira brought in nearly $5 billion last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, it's a mixed bag. And then Biogen at number five-their top seller Humira brought in nearly five dollars billion last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pharmaceutical giant Amgen ranks fifth. Arthritis drug Enbrel is its top-selling product, bringing in nearly $6 billion in sales last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the work-life balance reviews were… not great. One person said it was "terrible, terrible."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the work-life balance reviews were... not great. One person said it was terrible, terrible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The work-life balance is great, fantastic daycare on campus, lots of smart co-workers, wrote one CareerBliss reviewer.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild how these lists can have such contrasting insider perspectives.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild how these lists can have such contrasting insider perspectives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Makes you wonder how they weight those survey responses against each other.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Makes you wonder how they weight those survey responses against each other.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And Fidelity Growth was even mentioned earlier as struggling, despite investing in positively-rated workplaces.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And Fidelity Growth was even mentioned earlier as struggling, despite investing in positively-rated workplaces.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, a mutual fund that invests in companies with positive workplace ratings, Parnassus Endeavor, has beaten the market handily over the past 10 years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So maybe happy employees don't always mean happy returns?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So maybe happy employees don't always mean happy returns?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Seems like it's way more complicated than that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seems like it's way more complicated than that.

artist_script:
Downtown Austin, Texas, home to the nation's happiest company.
HostA: Keller Williams Realty just topped Monster.com’s list of happiest companies for 2018.
HostB: Oh wow, with 175,000 agents? That’s a massive real estate franchise. And they uh, really emphasize internal promotion, right?
HostA: Yeah, one employee mentioned that—how they’re everyone is encouraged to control their own growth path. It sounds like a pretty empowering culture.
HostB: And Adidas came in second, which is interesting 'cause they're going through this big shift to sell more directly through their own stores and site.
HostA: Right, the Adidas Direct initiative. Meanwhile, Microsoft landed in fourth place, which is… surprising given some of the employee comments.
HostB: Oh yeah, I saw that—someone called the atmosphere highly competitive and draining. But then they also mention PDFs saving like, 80% on costs?
HostA: Exactly, it’s a mixed bag. And then Biogen at number five—their top seller Humira brought in nearly $5 billion last year.
HostB: But the work-life balance reviews were… not great. One person said it was "terrible, terrible."
HostA: It’s wild how these lists can have such contrasting insider perspectives.
HostB: For sure. Makes you wonder how they weight those survey responses against each other.
HostA: Absolutely. And Fidelity Growth was even mentioned earlier as struggling, despite investing in positively-rated workplaces.
HostB: Huh. So maybe happy employees don’t always mean happy returns?
HostA: Seems like it’s way more complicated than that.
